title: Beaker
synopsis: Beaker is an experimental Peer-to-Peer web browser, using Dat Protocol. [https://beakerbrowser.com/ site]

title: dat
synopsis: [[Dat]] is an open source project that provides a streaming interface between every file format and data storage backend. API's include [[Command Line]], [[REST]], and [[JavaScript]]

title: Decentralised protocols
synopsis: Here we review the rapidly expanding ecosystem of decentralised protocols that we can build with. We can use these protocols to create architectures that are p2p or federated, but that do not rely on conventional centralised servers.

title: Decentralized Technology
synopsis: In recent times there has been a lot of interest in building decentralised technologies for the web. historically there have been many such attempts, but the newer technology stacks, thanks in no small part to the perceived success of [[blockchain]] technology, looks particulalry promissing.

title: Ethereum
synopsis: Web 3.0 publishing platform. Purpose of Ethereum is to decentralise the Web. Read more on [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ethereum Wikipedia] and [https://forum.ethereum.org Ethereum forum]

title: Fedwiki Tools
synopsis: Here we list a few tools that are of particular use in managing and creating [[Fedwiki]] content.

title: Holochain
synopsis: Holographic storage for distributed applications. A holochain is a validating distributed hash table (DHT) where every node enforces validation rules on data against the signed chains where the data originated - [http://ceptr.org/projects/holochain ceptr.org]

title: IPFS
synopsis: IPFS stands for the [[InterPlanetary File System]]. IPFS is a bold attempt at evolving the Internet's infrastructure.

title: Polkadot
synopsis: Present-day blockchain architectures all suffer from a number of issues not least practical means of extensi- bility and scalability - [https://polkadot.io/ polkadot.io]

title: Secure Scuttlebutt
synopsis: Scuttlebutt is a decent(ralised) secure gossip platform. Historically, sea-slang for gossip - a scuttlebutt is basically a watercooler on a ship.

title: Welcome Visitors
synopsis: The [[Outlandish Academy]] is a P2P framework for creating online and offline learning experiences. Here we research and gather information about [[Decentralized Technology]] that we can use to [[Redecentralize The Web]].
